item.title: “Coloradans sent a message loud and clear that they want us to...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

“Coloradans sent a message loud and clear that they want us to continue moving our state forward and that’s just what we’ll do,” said Democratic Rep. Leslie Herod of Denver, chair of the Colorado Black Democratic Legislative Caucus.”

Colorado Public Radio

With two races outstanding, it appears that the balance of power in the state legislature will remain pretty much the same, with Democrats in solid control of both chambers.

cpr.org

State Legislature Looks To Next Year After An Election That Delivered Few Changes

With two races outstanding, it appears that the balance of power in the state legislature will remain pretty much the same, with Democrats in solid control of both chambers.With two races outstanding, it appears that the balance of power in the state legislature will remain pretty much the same, with Democrats in solid control of both chambers.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: “Hancock is calling the mandate a “home-by-10” order....
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

“Hancock is calling the mandate a “home-by-10” order. It’s aimed at restricting nighttime gatherings at bars, clubs and restaurants, as well as private gatherings.

Denverites covered by the order must stay in their homes until 5 a.m. each day. It is in effect until Nov. 28, though it is temporarily suspended on Thanksgiving. There are exemptions for critical businesses, employees returning home from work, first responders and people who may be traveling.”

The Colorado Sun

The new restrictions in Denver come after Gov. Jared Polis on Thursday, along with Colorado's top epidemiologist, warned coronavirus is circulating in the state at its highest rate since the pandemic began

coloradosun.com

Denver orders city residents to be at home by 10 p.m. in attempt to slow coronavirus

The new restrictions in Denver come after Gov. Jared Polis on Thursday, along with Colorado's top epidemiologist, warned coronavirus is circulating in the state at its highest rate since the pandemic beganThe new restrictions in Denver come after Gov. Jared Polis on Thursday, along with Colorado's top epidemiologist, warned coronavirus is circulating in the state at its highest rate since the pandemic began
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: “This is an historic election,” said Colorado Secretary of...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

“This is an historic election,” said Colorado Secretary of State Jena Griswold in a statement. “More Coloradans voted in this election than in any previous election in our state’s history, even in the midst of a pandemic. Colorado’s elections set the gold standard for the nation: it is clear that when people have access, they will vote.”

The Colorado Sun

Members of both major parties and unaffiliated voters all cast ballots at record-high rates, but Democratic counties led the way

coloradosun.com

More Coloradans than ever voted this year, and the state’s turnout ranks in the top 5 nationwide

Members of both major parties and unaffiliated voters all cast ballots at record-high rates, but Democratic counties led the wayMembers of both major parties and unaffiliated voters all cast ballots at record-high rates, but Democratic counties led the waySee the latest updates on the 2020 US Election. See Election Updates
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: “According to unofficial election results, voters passed three...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

“According to unofficial election results, voters passed three measures that give the council more say in how the government gears churn. The charter changes, known as 2E, 2G and 2C, push back just a little bit on Denver’s “strong-mayor” form of government, which centers power in the executive branch.”

Denverite

But the position of mayor is still ripped, muscularly speaking.

denverite.com

If Denver’s voting results stick, city council will gain some power in a mayor-strong government

But the position of mayor is still ripped, muscularly speaking.But the position of mayor is still ripped, muscularly speaking.See the latest updates on the 2020 US Election. See Election Updates
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: “Two days after Election Day, the churn of results is expected...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

“Two days after Election Day, the churn of results is expected to offer more clarity Thursday on the destiny of the race and when the final result might become known. Biden currently leads with 253 electoral votes to Trump's 213, and 270 electoral votes are needed to win the presidency.”

CNN

The cliffhanger election is moving to a pivotal moment in Pennsylvania, Georgia, Arizona and Nevada as the races tighten and final votes are counted that could swing the White House toward former Vice President Joe Biden or hand President Donald Trump a second term.

cnn.com

Race for the White House narrows as votes are counted in key battlegrounds

The cliffhanger election is moving to a pivotal moment in Pennsylvania, Georgia, Arizona and Nevada as the races tighten and final votes are counted that could swing the White House toward former Vice President Joe Biden or hand President Donald Trump a second term.The cliffhanger election is moving to a pivotal moment in Pennsylvania, Georgia, Arizona and Nevada as the races tighten and final votes are counted that could swing the White House toward former Vice President Joe Biden or hand President Donald Trump a second term.See the latest updates on the 2020 US Election. See Election Updates
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: “Voters in Denver overwhelmingly voted to pass Ballot Measure...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

“Voters in Denver overwhelmingly voted to pass Ballot Measure 2J to lift the city's more than 30-year-old ban on pit bulls.

Ballot Measure 2J passed with 64.5% voting to lift the ban and 35.5% voting to keep the ban in place.”

Denver7

Voters in Denver overwhelmingly voted to pass Ballot Measure 2J to lift the city's more than 30-year-old ban on pit bulls.

thedenverchannel.com

Denver voters overwhelmingly pass ballot measure to repeal pit bull ban

Voters in Denver overwhelmingly voted to pass Ballot Measure 2J to lift the city's more than 30-year-old ban on pit bulls.Voters in Denver overwhelmingly voted to pass Ballot Measure 2J to lift the city's more than 30-year-old ban on pit bulls.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: “In a national first, Colorado voters are leaning toward...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

“In a national first, Colorado voters are leaning toward joining the national popular vote movement to change the way the U.S. picks presidents.”

The Colorado Sun

Voters weighed in on whether to repeal a 2019 law that could eventually contribute to fundamental changes to U.S. presidential elections

coloradosun.com

Colorado narrowly favors keeping national popular vote law in early returns

Voters weighed in on whether to repeal a 2019 law that could eventually contribute to fundamental changes to U.S. presidential electionsVoters weighed in on whether to repeal a 2019 law that could eventually contribute to fundamental changes to U.S. presidential electionsSee the latest updates on the 2020 US Election. See Election Updates
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: “Colorado State Rep. Leslie Herod is no stranger to blazing...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

“Colorado State Rep. Leslie Herod is no stranger to blazing trails. In 2016, she became the first LGBTQ African American elected to the Colorado General Assembly. She was the co-chair of the Kamala Harris for President campaign in Colorado, and is excited for the potential of Harris becoming the first Black female Vice President.

“First of all it will mean that little girls will dream to be in the highest office of this nation, they can see it. Little girls who look like little Leslies and little girls of color can say, ‘I can be her because she looks like me.’ A lot of people don’t even realize that you don’t even, these kids, don’t even dream of what they can be unless they see it. That’s why it’s so important that we have Black women represented across the board,” Herod told CBS4.”
CBS4 Local

Colorado Representative Leslie Herod is thrilled for the potential of having a Black woman in the Vice Presidency.

denver.cbslocal.com|By CBS Denver

Colorado Representative Leslie Herod Sees Strong Role Model In Kamala Harris Candidacy

Colorado Representative Leslie Herod is thrilled for the potential of having a Black woman in the Vice Presidency.Colorado Representative Leslie Herod is thrilled for the potential of having a Black woman in the Vice Presidency.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: THANK YOU! It’s an honor to continue fighting along side you...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

THANK YOU! It’s an honor to continue fighting along side you all as I begin my third term as your Representative. I promise you one thing - together, we will continue moving Colorado boldly forward. It’s time to get to work.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: “I have to vote. I have to let my voice be counted,” said...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

“I have to vote. I have to let my voice be counted,” said Cheryl, who is Black. “It’s a privilege for us to vote. We had to fight to vote. So I will vote.”

Denverite

“I have to vote. I have to let my voice be counted. It’s a privilege for us to vote. We had to fight to vote. So I will vote.”

denverite.com

What democracy means to three generations of a family in Five Points on Election Day

“I have to vote. I have to let my voice be counted. It’s a privilege for us to vote. We had to fight to vote. So I will vote.”“I have to vote. I have to let my voice be counted. It’s a privilege for us to vote. We had to fight to vote. So I will vote.”See the latest updates on the 2020 US Election. See Election Updates
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: “Denver City Council will vote on Mayor Michael Hancock’s...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

“Denver City Council will vote on Mayor Michael Hancock’s $1.3 billion budget next Monday after a tug-of-war between the legislative and executive branches, and some disagreement among council members over repurposing law enforcement dollars for other things.

Between a pandemic-plagued 2020 that has sapped consumer spending and an economic forecast next year that only looks slightly better, the city faces $190 million in lost revenue in 2021. The new budget projects economic growth next year with revenue gains a little under 2018 levels.”

Denverite

City council signaled Monday that it will pass Mayor Michael Hancock’s $1.3 billion budget. COVID-19 and money for law enforcement both shape the city’s priorities.

denverite.com

Denver’s spending plan for 2021 assumes a waning pandemic. Here’s what’s getting cut and what’s not.

City council signaled Monday that it will pass Mayor Michael Hancock’s $1.3 billion budget. COVID-19 and money for law enforcement both shape the city’s priorities.City council signaled Monday that it will pass Mayor Michael Hancock’s $1.3 billion budget. COVID-19 and money for law enforcement both shape the city’s priorities.

item.title: "Congratulations: You've made it to Election Day 2020....
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Congratulations: You've made it to Election Day 2020. If you haven't voted yet, no problem: Colorado makes it incredibly easy to vote up until 7 p.m. on November 3. You can even still register today, then vote.

To find out where, the polling location and drop box page on the Colorado Secretary of State's website has you covered. Simply type your address into the search field and you'll be directed to the spot nearest you — and state officials have put an emphasis on making all of these sites as safe as possible amid the COVID-19 pandemic."

Denver Westword

You haven't registered yet? No problem.

westword.com

Where to Vote or Drop Your Ballot in Denver on Election Day

You haven't registered yet? No problem.You haven't registered yet? No problem.See the latest updates on the 2020 US Election. See Election Updates
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: “Monday morning, newly-appointed Denver County Sheriff Elias...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

“Monday morning, newly-appointed Denver County Sheriff Elias Diggins allowed inmates who are awaiting trial or serving on a misdemeanor offense to vote in person, if they are eligible to vote.”

The new Sheriff said he wants to believe in the humanity of all people, even those in custody.

9news.com

Denver Sheriff allows inmates to vote in person for the first time in jail history

The new Sheriff said he wants to believe in the humanity of all people, even those in custody.The new Sheriff said he wants to believe in the humanity of all people, even those in custody.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: “Districts pursuing hybrid learning have good intentions —...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

“Districts pursuing hybrid learning have good intentions — among them, ensuring that kids can have some face-to-face interaction with educators and peers for their own social-emotional health and begin to regain a sense of normalcy after months of chaos and uncertainty. But is the benefit of bringing students back into classrooms once or twice a week worth the burden of adding more work to teachers, many of whom were already strained before the coronavirus?

There isn’t one clear answer.”

The Colorado Sun

A hybrid approach to school gives students the chance to see teachers and peers in person. But is it also burning out educators?

coloradosun.com

Colorado teachers are working twice — sometimes three times — as hard when their students learn both in person and online

A hybrid approach to school gives students the chance to see teachers and peers in person. But is it also burning out educators?A hybrid approach to school gives students the chance to see teachers and peers in person. But is it also burning out educators?

VOTE TODAY & join us at the Voter Celebration Social starting tonight at 4 PM at Improper City. Register in advance and receive a ‘buy one get one’ draft beer with proof of registration. For more information & to register click here: https://bit.ly/3oKTU79 See you tonight!

item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: "At first glance, the fourth jersey in the windows looks...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"At first glance, the fourth jersey in the windows looks like a Nuggets uniform. Instead of the Nuggets’ six stripes across the chest, Rivero’s Elijah McClain jersey has four, because a violin has four strings. McClain, 23, was a violinist who died in a Denver suburb. After McClain was violently detained by Aurora police, paramedics arrived and administered a large dose of ketamin to sedate him. McClain died in the hospital last August.

With each jersey, Rivero said, “I’m keeping this person’s story alive, protesting injustice. I’m enabling the message of protest.”

Denverite

Jerseys that commemorate Black victims of police brutality fly at Leon Gallery“You want every jersey to be the last one. But you kind of know, intrinsically, that something’s going to happen again.”Jerseys that commemorate Black victims of police brutality fly at Leon Gallery“You want every jersey to be the last one. But you kind of know, intrinsically, that something’s going to happen again.”See more at DENVERITE.COM
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have community support for this work. We all have a story to tell. Our stories are our strength and our voices will be heard.

"Forget political stereotypes: This history-making legislator is unapologetically progressive, is insistent that state government can be bipartisan (even now), and wants to transform the criminal justice system. And that's just the start of her ambitions.”

- 5280 Magazine

...
